resource.name: Iowa Liquor Sales
resource.description:
This dataset contains the spirits purchase information of Iowa Class “E” liquor licensees by product and date of purchase from January 1, 2012 to current.  The dataset can be used to analyze total spirits sales in Iowa of individual products at the store level.

Class E liquor license, for grocery stores, liquor stores, convenience stores, etc., allows commercial establishments to sell liquor for off-premises consumption in original unopened containers.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Commerce, Alcoholic Beverages Division
columns_description: Total cost of liquor order (number of bottles multiplied by the state bottle retail)
The number of bottles of liquor ordered by the store
The amount the store paid for each bottle of liquor ordered
The amount that Alcoholic Beverages Division paid for each bottle of liquor ordered
The vendor name of the company for the brand of liquor ordered
Category of the liquor ordered.
County where the store who ordered the liquor is located
Iowa county number for the county where store who ordered the liquor is located
Zip code where the store who ordered the liquor is located
Name of store who ordered the liquor.
Date of order
The number of bottles in a case for the liquor ordered
Description of the individual liquor product ordered.
Item number for the individual liquor product ordered.
The vendor number of the company for the brand of liquor ordered
Address of store who ordered the liquor.
Unique number assigned to the store who ordered the liquor.
Concatenated invoice and line number associated with the liquor order.  This provides a unique identifier for the individual liquor products included in the store order

Location of store who ordered the liquor.  The Address, City, State and Zip Code are geocoded to provide geographic coordinates.  Accuracy of geocoding is dependent on how well the address is interpreted and the completeness of the reference data used.
Total volume of liquor ordered in gallons. (i.e. (Bottle Volume (ml) x Bottles Sold)/3785.411784)
Total volume of liquor ordered in liters.  (i.e. (Bottle Volume (ml) x Bottles Sold)/1,000)
Volume of each liquor bottle ordered in milliliters.
City where the store who ordered the liquor is located
Category code associated with the liquor ordered

domain_metadata.value: This data is updated monthly.  Data updates are typically available on the first day of each month.

resource.name: Insurance Companies Licensed in Iowa
resource.description: The Iowa Insurance Division regulates and supervises the business of insurance in Iowa.  This dataset provides a list of insurance companies licensed to do business in Iowa.
columns_description: Presents former names the company operated as.  Their name has changed due to re-branding, acquisitions or mergers.
A more detailed classification for the type of insurance company.
Unique number assigned by the Iowa Insurance Division.  Known internally as "active_code."
Unique number assigned by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC).
Type of insurance company:  Life, Health, Property Casualty, County Mutual, State Mutual, Benevolent, Fraternal, or MEWA (Multiple Employer Welfare Arrangements).
Name of insurance company.
Location based on alternate address.
Iowa Domiciled, whether the company is organized under Iowa law, is indicated by a check mark.  Check mark = true.  Null value = false.
Location based on company address.

The federal government recently extended the permissible period of time for which short-term limited-duration health insurance policies can be issued.  There are different requirements for the plans depending on the length.  If a company offers you a plan for a period of 90 days or greater, there are a number of benefits that must be provided as part of the policy.   It is important to note that the plans that are shorter than 90 days may not provide comprehensive benefits and are unlikely to provide coverage for any pre-existing conditions you may have.
Indicates whether company is owned by stockholders (stock) or policyholders (mutual).

resource.name: Insurance Producers Licensed in Iowa
resource.description:
The Iowa Insurance Division is responsible for issuing licenses or authority for many types of regulated individuals dealing with insurance related products.  Individuals interested in becoming either a resident or non-resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa need to apply through the National Insurance Producer Registry (NIPR) online system.  Those wishing to become a resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa must successfully pass the appropriate Iowa producer licensing exam for that specific line of authority.

To add additional lines of authority, a resident or non-resident insurance producer licensed in the state of Iowa need to apply through the NIPR online system.  Resident insurance producers wishing to add a line of authority must successfully pass the appropriate Iowa producer licensing exam for that specific line of authority.

This dataset provides a listing of resident and non-resident insurance producers licensed to sell to Iowans.
columns_description: Date Iowa License was first active.
Date Iowa License will expire.
Yes indicates the provider offers this insurance product.
Yes indicates the provider offers this insurance product.

Column indicates whether the producer resides in Iowa.
Physical Location of licensed insurance producer based on street address contained within mailing address if available.
Yes indicates the provider offers this insurance product.

resource.name: State of Iowa Salary Book
resource.description:
The dataset contains the name, gender, county or city of residence (when possible), official title, total salary received during each fiscal year, base salary for the employee, and traveling and subsistence expense reimbursed to state personnel beginning with Fiscal Year 2007.

A status of "TERMINATED" in the column providing the base salary does not indicate that the employee was fired, only that the person no longer works in that position.
resource.attribution: Iowa Department of Administrative Services, State of Iowa Salary Book
columns_description: Date base salary was computed
Annual, biweekly or hourly base salary for the employee
City or county where the state employee resides (where available)
Name of the employee
Department employing the individual
Total salary paid during Fiscal Year
Position the state employee held during Fiscal Year
Department sub-agency or institution employing the individual (where applicable)
Fiscal year (July 1 - June 30) salary data is associated with
Total travel & subsistance expenses reimbursed during Fiscal Year
Gender of the employee

domain_metadata.value: Some employees may show up multiple times where they were employed by more than one department during the fiscal year, reflecting their total salary paid twice.

The dataset contains information on personnel from all state government departments, boards, commissions, institutions, and Regents institutions (e.g. ISU, UNI and U of I) unless personnel receive an annual salary of less than one thousand dollars. Community Based Corrections officers and State Fair Board members are not included in the dataset.
Data is updated annually.  Updates are typically available in November.
